t: Jeremiah 48
Judgment on Moab

Concerning*p Moab. Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: “Woe*pn to Nebo, for it is laid waste! Kiriathaim*ld is put to shame, it is taken; the*ln fortress is put to shame and broken down;

the*ld renown of Moab is no more. In*ln Heshbon they planned disaster against her: ‘Come,*ld let us cut her off from being a nation!’ You*ln also, O Madmen, shall be brought to silence; the*ld sword shall pursue you.
“A*pn voice! A cry from Horonaim, ‘Desolation*ld and great destruction!’
Moab*ln is destroyed; her*ld little ones have made a cry.
For*ln at the ascent of Luhith they*ld go up weeping; for*ln at the descent of Horonaim they*ld have heard the distressed cry of destruction.
Flee!*ln Save yourselves! You*ld will be like a juniper in the desert!
For,*ln because you trusted in your works and your treasures, you*ld also shall be taken; and*ln Chemosh shall go into exile with*ld his priests and his officials.
The*ln destroyer shall come upon every city, and*ld no city shall escape; the*ln valley shall perish, and*ld the plain shall be destroyed, as*ld the Lord*s has spoken.
“Give*pn wings to Moab, for*ld she would fly away; her*ln cities shall become a desolation, with*ld no inhabitant in them.
“Cursed*p is he who does the work of the Lord*s with slackness, and cursed is he who keeps back his sword from bloodshed.

“Moab*pn has been at ease from his youth and*ld has settled on his dregs; he*ln has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, nor*ld has he gone into exile; so*ln his taste remains in him, and*ld his scent is not changed.
“Therefore,*p behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord,*s when I shall send to him pourers who will pour him, and empty his vessels and break his jars in pieces.
Then Moab shall be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
“How*pn do you say, ‘We are heroes and*ld mighty men of war’?
The*ln destroyer of Moab and his cities has come up, and*ld the choicest of his young men have gone down to slaughter, declares*ld the King, whose name is the Lord*s of hosts.
The*ln calamity of Moab is near at hand, and*ld his affliction hastens swiftly.
Grieve*ln for him, all you who are around him, and*ld all who know his name; say,*ln ‘How the mighty scepter is broken, the*ld glorious staff.’
“Come*pn down from your glory, and*ld sit on the parched ground, O*ld inhabitant of Dibon! For*ln the destroyer of Moab has come up against you; he*ld has destroyed your strongholds.
Stand*ln by the way and watch, O*ld inhabitant of Aroer! Ask*ln him who flees and her who escapes; say,*ld ‘What has happened?’
Moab*ln is put to shame, for it is broken; wail*ld and cry! Tell*ln it beside the Arnon, that*ld Moab is laid waste.
“Judgment*p has come upon the tableland, upon Holon, and Jahzah, and Mephaath,
and Dibon, and Nebo, and Beth-diblathaim,
and Kiriathaim, and Beth-gamul, and Beth-meon,
and Kerioth, and Bozrah, and all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.
The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken, declares the Lord.*s
“Make*p him drunk, because he magnified himself against the Lord,*s so that Moab shall wallow in his vomit, and he too shall be held in derision.
Was not Israel a derision to you? Was he found among thieves, that whenever you spoke of him you wagged your head?
“Leave*pn the cities, and dwell in the rock, O*ld inhabitants of Moab! Be*ln like the dove that nests in*ld the sides of the mouth of a gorge.
We*ln have heard of the pride of Moab— he*ld is very proud— of*ln his loftiness, his pride, and his arrogance, and*ld the haughtiness of his heart.
I*ln know his insolence, declares the Lord;*s his*ld boasts are false, his*ld deeds are false.
Therefore*ln I wail for Moab; I*ld cry out for all Moab; for*ld the men of Kir-hareseth I mourn.
More*ln than for Jazer I weep for you, O*ld vine of Sibmah! Your*ln branches passed over the sea, reached*ld to the Sea of Jazer; on*ln your summer fruits and your grapes the*ld destroyer has fallen.

Gladness*ln and joy have been taken away from*ld the fruitful land of Moab; I*ln have made the wine cease from the winepresses; no*ld one treads them with shouts of joy; the*ld shouting is not the shout of joy.
“From*p the outcry at Heshbon even to Elealeh, as far as Jahaz they utter their voice, from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiyah. For the waters of Nimrim also have become desolate.
And I will bring to an end in Moab, declares the Lord,*s him who offers sacrifice in the high place and makes offerings to his god.
Therefore my heart moans for Moab like a flute, and my heart moans like a flute for the men of Kir-hareseth. Therefore the riches they gained have perished.
“For*p every head is shaved and every beard cut off. On all the hands are gashes, and around the waist is sackcloth.
On all the housetops of Moab and in the squares there is nothing but lamentation, for I have broken Moab like a vessel for which no one cares, declares the Lord.*s
How it is broken! How they wail! How Moab has turned his back in shame! So Moab has become a derision and a horror to all that are around him.”
For*pn thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*ln one shall fly swiftly like an eagle and*ld spread his wings against Moab;
the*ln cities shall be taken and*ld the strongholds seized. The*ln heart of the warriors of Moab shall be in that day like*ld the heart of a woman in her birth pains;
Moab*ln shall be destroyed and be no longer a people, because*ld he magnified himself against the Lord.*s
Terror,*ln pit, and snare are*ld before you, O inhabitant of Moab! declares*l the Lord.*s

He*ln who flees from the terror shall*ld fall into the pit, and*ln he who climbs out of the pit shall*ld be caught in the snare. For*ln I will bring these things upon Moab, the*ld year of their punishment, declares*l the Lord.*s

“In*pn the shadow of Heshbon fugitives*ld stop without strength, for*ln fire came out from Heshbon, flame*ld from the house of Sihon; it*ln has destroyed the forehead of Moab, the*ld crown of the sons of tumult.
Woe*ln to you, O Moab! The*ld people of Chemosh are undone, for*ln your sons have been taken captive, and*ld your daughters into captivity.
Yet*ln I will restore the fortunes of Moab in*ld the latter days, declares the Lord.”*s Thus*ln far is the judgment on Moab.
